JobFullDesc:
You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.
At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways.  Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible - and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way. When you join #TeamAmex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day.
You won’t just shape the world of Voice Services.
You’ll shape the world of life, work and play.
Our Engineering Managers not only understand how technology works, but how technology intersects with the people who count on it every day. Today, innovative ideas, insight and new perspectives are at the core of how we create a more powerful, personal, and fulfilling experience for all our customers. So, if you’re interested in a career ensuring the availability of our Global Voice Infrastructure and Voice Carrier Connectivity, look no further.
You won’t just keep up; you’ll break new ground.  
There are hundreds of opportunities to make your mark on technology and life at American Express. Here’s just some of what you’ll be doing:

Taking your place as the leader of a Global Voice Infrastructure team driving the latest observability and availability practices
Managing people yet staying close to Voice Engineering by participating in design reviews of new carrier SIP deployments and Avaya Architecture discussions
Identifying opportunities for adopting new technologies across automation and observability spaces
Leading a team of global engineers that deliver highly reliable enterprise class Voice Solutions to our customers worldwide
Partnering with Carrier vendors to maximize strong support, strategy, and recovery 


7+ years’ experience with Avaya Call Center Operational/Engineering support
2+ years of extensive IT and business/industry work experience with proven experience in a Leadership and Program Management/Engineering role
Preferably BS or MS Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or other Technical discipline
Strong people leadership skills with proven track record of leading through influencing
Proven experience in automating ITSM and Incident processes
Ability to work with Senior Engineers to determine Root Cause Analysis and short/long term fixes 
Possess the ability to influence without authority, innovate, self-direct/initiate, problem solve and execute with minimal guidance
Possess the ability to navigate through a large organization and develop strong relationships across IT and the business
Ability to communicate problems/issues across multiple levels of leadership and obtain concurrence on go-forward approach quickly for time critical issues
Good understanding of Change Management, Problem Management, and Incident Management processes 
Ability to effectively interpret Technical/Business objectives and challenges and articulate solutions
Willingness to learn new Technologies and exploit them to their optimal potential

At the core of Voice Engineering every member of our team, including engineering leaders must be able to demonstrate the following technical, functional, leadership and business core competencies: 

Agile Practices
System Design
Business Analysis
Analytical Thinking
Business Product Knowledge
